pr_title: FM2-40 Implement OMOD unit tests for Task, Service Request, and Diagnostic Report

timeline.message: Implemented basic OMOD unit tests for Task and ServiceRequest for FM2-40.
Implemented basic Task OMOD unit tests for FM2-40.

timeline.bodyText: We should have one testing naming convention per file. I'd probably prefer changing this one to updateTask_shouldUpdateTask()
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.message: Test fixes and first attempt at Create/Update web tests

timeline.author: ibacher

This probably also should have:
request.setHeader(CONTENT_TYPE, FhirMediaTypes.JSON.toString());
timeline.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText:
You almost certainly need something here like:
when(service.updateDiagnosticReport(any(), any())).thenReturn(diagnosticReport);
timeline.author: ibacher
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -84,7 +113,8 @@ public void updateDiagnosticReport_shouldUpdateExistingDiagnosticReport() throws
 		DiagnosticReport diagnosticReport = new DiagnosticReport();

timeline.message: Test fixes and first attempt at Create/Update web tests

timeline.bodyText: I can't figure out why this test (and the corresponding Task Web test) return status code 0 instead of 405. The MethodNotAllowedException seems to not be getting handled correctly, and I couldn't untangle it after looking into it a bit.
timeline.author: pmanko

replies.bodyText: I'd need to dig into this a bit. 0 is not an HTTP status code...
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: Ok. The problem here is a bit subtle, but because MethodNotAllowedException has no default constructor (i.e., a constructor that takes no arguments), there's a deeper error happening causes the wrong exception to be thrown causing the weird return code. To fix this, simple change the .thenThrow() part to something like .thenThrow(new MethodNotAllowedException("DiagnosticReport " + WRONG_UUID + " does not exist")) and the test will work as expected.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if this test is necessary, and if the error handling for updates in the DiagnosticReport and Task ServiceImpl are necessary either. The error handling gets handled by the HAPI libraries, and when(service.updateDiatnosticReport()) is not needed for this and ShouldErrorForIdMismatch() tests. In other words, the error handling implementation for these to cases doesn't seem to have an effect on the handling of the actual request.
timeline.author: pmanko

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I mostly worry about using these tests to ensure that we've done our part of the mappings properly, i.e., when someone sends the expected message our code handles the response appropriately. Since this is purely a test of the HAPI library, I don't think we need it, provided it works with an appropriately formulated request.
replies.author: ibacher

timeline.bodyText: This should be !diagnosticReport.getId().equals(uuid). Strings are objects and for objects == asserts that they refer to the same object. This works when the strings are all generated inside the VM because of Java's string interning but is likely to fail in a real-world situation.
timeline.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: Yes, I wanted to close this one out and extend/add tests for the new features from FM2-75 in a smaller PR.
